instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Arrived with minor liquid damage near trackpad connector, CD3217s and backlight area. Cleaned up components but stuck at 5V 0 amps

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 0v    diode mode 0.350

<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL>  1.070V 0.215 diode

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.620v  0.900 diode

What should be checked next??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Looks like USB-C problem.
5V input voltage should go through <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips until F3000/1.
Check the fuses and diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
fuses are good.

.521 diode and 5.2V on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Then you must have 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> too.
Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>EN_VR1</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL>*, A/BMON, <SIGNAL>CHGR_CBC_ON</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> 1.289V

VDDA 5V

VDDP 5V

<SIGNAL>EN_VR1</SIGNAL> Using 01521 boardview for reference and <SIGNAL>EN_VR1</SIGNAL> just shows as not connected??

<SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL> only shows under <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

AMON 5.20V

BMON only shows under <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>??

<SIGNAL>CHGR_CBC_ON</SIGNAL> only shows under <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
I gave you shorter names, inside the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Please follow external names connected to same pins!!!

On 01521 boardview, <SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> appears at <RESISTOR>R5470</RESISTOR>.
Follow <SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL>, instead of <SIGNAL>EN_VR1</SIGNAL>; sorry for mistake.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
"AMON 5.20V"
Are you sure about this?
It is really strange value; check <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/21/22 and traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> has 5.20V on all four pins. 21/22 are good along with their traces.

AMON only appears on <RESISTOR>R5472</RESISTOR> which is next to T2. Layout on 01521 is much different then 01958 in this area so no not 100% sure.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: If you surelly located <RESISTOR>R5472</RESISTOR>, there must be less than 1V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.620v  0.900 diode"
Strange value; did you check with red probe at ground?
Also be aware, L7030 is not <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>; check at F7000.
